user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_softirq_set:
```c
void metal_softirq_set(int irq)
{
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;

	cntr = &metal_softirq_cntr;

	if (irq < cntr->irq_base ||
	    irq >= (cntr->irq_base + cntr->irq_num)) {
		return;
	}

	irq -= cntr->irq_base;
	atomic_store(&metal_softirq_pending[irq], 1);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_softirq_set:
static METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE(metal_softirq_cntr,
				    METAL_IRQ_ANY, METAL_SOFTIRQ_NUM,
				    NULL,
				    metal_softirq_set_enable, NULL,
				    metal_softirqs)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No use of the standard library function memcmp appears in the provided code fragments. The function metal_softirq_set only performs integer comparisons (bounds check on irq), arithmetic (irq -= cntr->irq_base), and an atomic_store; there are no char arrays, strings, or string-comparison operations shown. The additional line shows a macro invocation (METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE) but its provided form does not include any memcmp or string-comparison usage. Therefore there are no code locations in the shown code that need investigation for Rule 21.14 (prohibiting memcmp for null-terminated string comparison). If expansions of omitted macros or other files exist, they would need to be reviewed separately, but based on the supplied code there are no suspicious fragments.
